title: Secrets of the Rich: Utilizing Tax Code for Business Expenses
subtitle: Discover how wealthy individuals leverage the US Tax Code to maximize their benefits legally, including renting homes for business purposes without IRS documentation.
content:
Secrets of the Rich: Utilizing Tax Code for Business Expenses

Dad, would you tell me a secret of the rich?

Absolutely. Each year, I rent out our home in Miami for $2,000 a night. I do this for 14 days.

Isn't that illegal?

No, just taking advantage of Section 280A of the US Tax Code. Because I rent it out to my business for our annual shareholders meeting, I turn around and write off the entire $28,000 as a business expense.

How did you learn about this?

Just follow Social Cap. It makes complex finance seem easy and legal.
